comments:
N20031005

I tried to import the unshared projects of my workspace (everything but debug
and ant plug-ins) and got an NPE :

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.osgi.bundle.BundlePluginModelBase.isValid(BundlePluginModelBase.java:168)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.osgi.OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.isValid(OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.java:1090)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.osgi.OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.validate(OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.java:1070)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.osgi.OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.validate(OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.java:1059)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.osgi.OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.getAllModels(OSGiWorkspaceModelManager.java:431)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard.getWorkspaceCounterparts(PluginImportWizard.java:238)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard.access$2(PluginImportWizard.java:237)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard$4.run(PluginImportWizard.java:172)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1555)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1572)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.PluginImportWizard$2.run(PluginImportWizard.java:140)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:101)


After this exception, I cannot re-compile my workspace (generates 8000+
compilation error).

I don't get this problem with N20031003.

Since you managed to trip the new experimental OSGi support in PDE, I assume 
you do this with the OSGi runtime build, not a regular Eclipse build?

Nope.
I downloaded the nightly N20031005, unzip it, launched it on an existing
workspace, and did file>import ... >external plugin, next, click on 'existing
unshared', finish, and tada!!
I retried at least twice and got the same error.

I have bracketed the new support using the checkbox in the 'In Progress' 
preference page. You should not see this again unless you turn this checkbox 
on. Try with tonight's nightly build (i.e. on Monday).
I will keep this defect to debug the NPE when OSGi support is turned on.

OK, found out the problem. It appears some of the plug-ins in the main 
development stream (HEAD) now have extra OSGi bundle information (META-
INF/MANIFEST.MF), so PDE tried to treat them as bundles.

Mystery solved. NPE is fixed now, and I will continue OSGi work behind 
the 'Work In Progress' checkbox.
